result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Samuel V Green V in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Samuel V Green V.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cuevas indicated that defendant is requesting a new attorney. Court granted motion to withdraw and rescheduled Status Conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:11 PM Defendant Samuel V Green V in court in custody.  Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court for Samuel V Green V.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
